Sentencas: In this work, we report a 4,400 h test of a state-of-the-art Ni-YSZ (yttria stabilized zirconia) electrode supported solid oxide electrolysis cell.
Titulo: Degradation in Solid Oxide Electrolysis Cells During Long Term Testing

Sentencas: The electrolysis test was carried out at 800 degrees C, -1
Titulo: Degradation in Solid Oxide Electrolysis Cells During Long Term Testing

Sentencas: A cm(-2) with 10% H-2 + 90% H2O supplied to Ni-YSZ electrode compartment.
Titulo: Degradation in Solid Oxide Electrolysis Cells During Long Term Testing

Sentencas: Except for the first 250 h of fast initial degradation, the cell showed rather stable performance with a moderate degradation rate of around 25 mV per 1,000 h.
Titulo: Degradation in Solid Oxide Electrolysis Cells During Long Term Testing

Sentencas: The electrochemical impedance spectra (EIS) acquired during the test show that both serial resistance and electrode polarization resistance increased during the durability test.
Titulo: Degradation in Solid Oxide Electrolysis Cells During Long Term Testing

Sentencas: Further impedance analyzes show that both the LSCF (strontium and cobalt co-doped lanthanum ferrite)-CGO (gadolinium doped ceria) electrode and Ni-YSZ electrode degraded and the degradation was dominated by the Ni-YSZ electrode.
Titulo: Degradation in Solid Oxide Electrolysis Cells During Long Term Testing

Sentencas: Post mortem analysis on the Ni-YSZ electrode revealed loss of contact between Ni-Ni grains, Ni-YSZ grains and increased porosity inside the active layer.
Titulo: Degradation in Solid Oxide Electrolysis Cells During Long Term Testing

Sentencas: The microstructural changes were most severe at steam gas inlet and became less severe along the gas flow path.
Titulo: Degradation in Solid Oxide Electrolysis Cells During Long Term Testing

Sentencas: The present test results show that this type of cell can be used for early demonstration of solid oxide cell operation at electrolysis current densities around 1 A cm(-2).
Titulo: Degradation in Solid Oxide Electrolysis Cells During Long Term Testing
